95 typedef struct boot_dbparm BOOT_DB_PARM;
96 struct boot_dbparm
97 {
98  VFID trk_vfid; /* Tracker of files */
99  HFID hfid; /* Heap file where this information is stored. It is only used for validation purposes */
100  HFID rootclass_hfid; /* Heap file where classes are stored */
101 #if 1 /* TODO - not used */
102  EHID classname_table; /* The hash file of class names */
103 #endif
104  CTID ctid; /* The catalog file */
105  /* TODO: Remove me */
106  VFID query_vfid; /* Query file */
107  char rootclass_name[10]; /* Name of the root class */
108  OID rootclass_oid; /* OID of the root class */
109  VOLID nvols; /* Number of volumes that have been created */
110  VOLID temp_nvols; /* Number of temporary volumes that have been created */
111  VOLID last_volid; /* Next volume identifier */
112  VOLID temp_last_volid; /* Next temporary volume identifier. This goes from a higher number to a lower number */
113  int vacuum_log_block_npages; /* Number of pages for vacuum data file */
114  VFID vacuum_data_vfid; /* Vacuum data file identifier */
115  VFID dropped_files_vfid; /* Vacuum dropped files file identifier */
116 };

206 /*
207  * bo_server) -set server's status, UP or DOWN
208  * return: void
209  * status(in) :
210  */
211 void
212 boot_server_status (BOOT_SERVER_STATUS status)
213 {
214  static const char *status_str[] = { "UNKNOWN", "UP", "DOWN", "MAINTENANCE" };
215  if (status >= BOOT_SERVER_UP && status <= BOOT_SERVER_MAINTENANCE)
216  {
217  boot_Server_status = status;
218  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_SERVER_STATUS, 1, status_str[status]);
219 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
220  if (boot_Set_server_at_exit == false)
221  {
222  boot_Set_server_at_exit = true;
223  boot_Server_process_id = getpid ();
224  (void) atexit (boot_shutdown_server_at_exit);
225  }
226 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
227  }
228 }
229 
230 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
231 /*
232  * bo_shutdown_server_at_exit () - make sure that the server is shutdown at exit
233  *
234  * return : nothing
235  *
236  * Note: This function is called when the invoked program terminates normally.
237  * This function make sure that the server is shutdown gracefully.
238  */
239 static void
240 boot_shutdown_server_at_exit (void)
241 {
242  if (BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED () && boot_Server_process_id == getpid ())
243  {
244  /* Avoid infinite looping if someone calls exit during shutdown */
245  boot_Server_process_id++;
246  THREAD_ENTRY *thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
247  (void) xboot_shutdown_server (thread_p, ER_ALL_FINAL);
248  }
249 }
250 
251 /*
252  * boot_donot_shutdown_server_at_exit () - do not shutdown server at exist.
253  *
254  * return : nothing
255  *
256  * Note: This function must be called when the system needs to exit without
257  * shutting down the system (e.g., in case of fatal failure).
258  */
259 void
260 boot_donot_shutdown_server_at_exit (void)
261 {
262  if (BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED () && boot_Server_process_id == getpid ())
263  {
264  boot_Server_process_id++;
265  }
266 }
267 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
268 
269 /*
270  * boot_get_db_parm () - retrieve database parameters from disk
271  *
272  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
273  *
274  * dbparm(out): database parameter structure
275  * dbparm_oid(in): oid of parameter object
276  *
277  * Note: Retrieve the database boot/restart parameters from disk.
278  */
279 static int
280 boot_get_db_parm (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BOOT_DB_PARM * dbparm, OID * dbparm_oid)
281 {
282  RECDES recdes;
283  HEAP_SCANCACHE scan_cache;
284  SCAN_CODE scan = S_SUCCESS;
285 
286  recdes.area_size = recdes.length = DB_SIZEOF (*dbparm);
287  recdes.data = (char *) dbparm;
288 
289  heap_scancache_quick_start_with_class_hfid (thread_p, &scan_cache, &boot_Db_parm->hfid);
290  scan = heap_first (thread_p, &boot_Db_parm->hfid, NULL, dbparm_oid, &recdes, &scan_cache, COPY);
291  heap_scancache_end (thread_p, &scan_cache);
292 
293  if (scan != S_SUCCESS)
294  {
295  assert (false);
296  return ER_FAILED;
297  }
298 
299  return NO_ERROR;
300 }
301 
302 /*
303  * boot_find_root_heap () - find the root heap
304  *
305  * return: NO_ERROR
306  *
307  * Note: Find the heap where the classes are stored.
308  */
309 int
310 boot_find_root_heap (HFID * root_hfid_p)
311 {
312  assert (root_hfid_p != NULL);
313  assert (!HFID_IS_NULL (&boot_Db_parm->rootclass_hfid));
314 
315  HFID_COPY (root_hfid_p, &boot_Db_parm->rootclass_hfid);
316 
317  return NO_ERROR;
318 }

320 /*
321  * xboot_find_number_permanent_volumes () - find the number of permanent volumes
322  *

324  */
325 int
326 xboot_find_number_permanent_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
327 {
328  int nvols;
329

331  disk_lock_extend ();

469 /*
470  * boot_remove_temp_volume () - remove a volume from the database
471  *
472  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
473  *
474  * volid(in): Volume identifier to remove
475  *
476  * Note: Remove a volume from the database. The deletion of the volume is done
477  * independently of the destiny of the current transaction. That is,
478  * if this function finishes successfully the removal is made permanent,
479  * if the function fails, whatever was done is aborted.
480  * Currently, we do not allow to remove permanent volumes. In the future
481  * we may allow the removal of any volume but the primary volume
482  * (LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID).
483  */
484 static int
485 boot_remove_temp_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid, const char *vlabel)
486 {
487  /* Make sure that this is a temporary volume */
488  if (volid < boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid)
489  {
490  if (volid >= LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID && volid <= boot_Db_parm->last_volid)
491  {
492  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_TRYING_TO_REMOVE_PERMANENT_VOLUME, 1,
493  fileio_get_volume_label (volid, PEEK));
494  return ER_BO_TRYING_TO_REMOVE_PERMANENT_VOLUME;
495  }
496  else
497  {
498  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_FILE_UNKNOWN_VOLID, 1, volid);
499  return ER_FILE_UNKNOWN_VOLID;
500  }
501  }
502 
503  /* Do the following for temporary volumes */
504  boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols--;
505  if (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols <= 0)
506  {
507  boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid = NULL_VOLID;
508  }
509  else if (boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid == volid)
510  {
511  boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid = volid + 1;
512  }
513 
514  /* The volume is not known by the system any longer. */
515  (void) pgbuf_invalidate_all (thread_p, volid);
516 
517  fileio_unformat (thread_p, vlabel);
518 
519  return NO_ERROR;
520 }
521 
522 /*
523  * xboot_add_volume_extension () - add a volume extension to the database
524  *
525  * return : volid or NULL_VOLID (in case of failure)
526  *
527  * ext_info(in): volume info
528  *
529  * Note: Add a volume extension to the database. The addition of the volume
530  * is a system operation that will be either aborted in case of failure
531  * or committed in case of success, independently on the destiny of the
532  * current transaction. The volume becomes immediately available to other
533  * transactions.
534  */
535 VOLID
536 xboot_add_volume_extension (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, DBDEF_VOL_EXT_INFO * ext_info)
537 {
538  VOLID volid;
539 
540  if (disk_add_volume_extension (thread_p, ext_info->purpose, ext_info->max_npages, ext_info->path, ext_info->name,
541  ext_info->comments, ext_info->max_writesize_in_sec, ext_info->overwrite, &volid)
542  != NO_ERROR)
543  {
544  ASSERT_ERROR ();
545  return NULL_VOLID;
546  }
547  assert (volid != NULL_VOLID);
548  return volid;
549 }
550 
551 /*
552  * boot_remove_useless_path_separator () - Remove useless PATH_SEPARATOR in path string
553  *
554  * return : true or false(in case of fail)
555  *
556  * path(in): Original path.
557  * new_path(out): Transformed path.
558  *
559  * Note: This function removes useless PATH_SEPARATOR in path string.
560  * For example,
561  * /home3/CUBRID/DB/ --> /home3/CUBRID/DB
562  * C:\CUBRID\\\Databases\\ --> C:\CUBRID\Databases
563  * \\pooh\user\ --> \\pooh\user
564  *
565  * After transform..
566  * If new path string is "/" or "\", don't remove the last slash.
567  * It is survived.
568  */
569 static void
570 boot_remove_useless_path_separator (const char *path, char *new_path)
571 {
572  int slash_num = 0; /* path separator counter */
573 
574  /* path must be not null */
575  assert (path != NULL);
576  assert (new_path != NULL);
577 
578  /*
579  * Before transform.
580  * / h o m e 3 / / w o r k / c u b r i d / / / w o r k /
581  *
582  * After transform.
583  * / h o m e 3 / w o r k / c u b r i d / w o r k
584  */
585 
586  /* Consume the preceding continuous slash chars. */
587  while (*path == PATH_SEPARATOR)
588  {
589  slash_num++;
590  path++;
591  }
592 
593  /* If there is preceding consumed slash, append PATH_SEPARATOR */
594  if (slash_num)
595  {
596  *new_path++ = PATH_SEPARATOR;
597 #if defined(WINDOWS)
598  /*
599  * In Windows/NT,
600  * If first duplicated PATH_SEPARATORs are appeared, they are survived.
601  * For example,
602  * \\pooh\user\ -> \\pooh\user(don't touch the first duplicated PATH_SEPARATORs)
603  */
604  if (slash_num > 1)
605  {
606  *new_path++ = PATH_SEPARATOR;
607  }
608 #endif /* WINDOWS */
609  }
610 
611  /* Initialize separator counter again. */
612  slash_num = 0;
613 
614  /*
615  * If current character is PATH_SEPARATOR,
616  * skip after increasing separator counter.
617  * If current character is normal character, copy to new_path.
618  */
619  while (*path)
620  {
621  if (*path == PATH_SEPARATOR)
622  {
623  slash_num++;
624  }
625  else
626  {
627  /*
628  * If there is consumed slash, append PATH_SEPARATOR.
629  * Initialize separator counter.
630  */
631  if (slash_num)
632  {
633  *new_path++ = PATH_SEPARATOR;
634  slash_num = 0;
635  }
636  *new_path++ = *path;
637  }
638  path++;
639  }
640 
641  /* Assure null terminated string */
642  *new_path = '\0';
643 }
644 
645 /*
646  * boot_parse_add_volume_extensions () - add a set of volume extensions
647  * to the database
648  *
649  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
650  *
651  * filename_addmore_vols(in): File name where the volume specifications are
652  * found
653  *
654  * Note: A set of volume extensions are added to the database. The given
655  * parameter is a file which indicates the specifications for all
656  * the volumes to be created. A volume is specified by ONE LINE which
657  * can contain the following parameters:
658  * [NAME volname] [PATH volpath] [COMMENTS volcomments]
659  * [PURPOSE volpurpose] PAGES volnpages
660  *
661  * The additions of the volumes is a system operations that will be either
662  * aborted in case of failure or committed in case of success,
663  * independently on the destiny of the current transaction. The volume
664  * becomes immediately available to other transactions.
665  */
666 static int
667 boot_parse_add_volume_extensions (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *filename_addmore_vols)
668 {
669  FILE *fp;
670  char input_buffer[BOOTSR_MAX_LINE + 1];
671  char *line;
672  char *token;
673  char *token_value;
674  char *ext_name;
675  char *ext_path;
676  char *ext_comments;
677  DKNPAGES ext_npages;
678  DISK_VOLPURPOSE ext_purpose;
679  int line_num = 0;
680  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
681  VOLID volid = NULL_VOLID;
682 
683  fp = fopen (filename_addmore_vols, "r");
684  if (fp == NULL)
685  {
686  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_USER_FILE_UNKNOWN, 1, filename_addmore_vols);
687  return ER_LOG_USER_FILE_UNKNOWN;
688  }
689 
690  /*
691  * Get a line
692  * Continue parsing even in case of error, so that we can indicate as
693  * many errors as possible.
694  */
695 
696  while ((line = fgets (input_buffer, BOOTSR_MAX_LINE, fp)) != NULL)
697  {
698  line_num++;
699 
700  /* Ignore lines with comments */
701 
702  if (line[0] == '\0' || line[0] == '#')
703  {
704  continue;
705  }
706 
707  ext_npages = (DKNPAGES) strlen (line);
708  if (line[ext_npages - 1] != '\n')
709  {
710  line[ext_npages] = '\n';
711  line[ext_npages + 1] = '\0';
712  }
713 
714  /*
715  * Parse the line
716  */
717 
718  ext_name = NULL;
719  ext_path = NULL;
720  ext_comments = NULL;
721  ext_npages = 0;
722  ext_purpose = DB_PERMANENT_DATA_PURPOSE;
723 
724  while (true)
725  {
726  /*
727  * Read token.. skip leading whitespace and comments
728  */
729  while (char_isspace (line[0]))
730  {
731  line++;
732  }
733 
734  if (line[0] == '\0')
735  {
736  break;
737  }
738 
739  token = line;
740 
741  do
742  {
743  line++;
744  }
745  while (!char_isspace (line[0]));
746  line[0] = '\0';
747  line++;
748 
749  /*
750  * Skip any whitespace before the value.
751  */
752 
753  while (char_isspace (line[0]))
754  {
755  line++;
756  }
757 
758  token_value = line;
759 
760  /*
761  * If string in " xxx " or ' xxxx ' find its delimiter
762  */
763 
764  if (token_value[0] == '"' || token_value[0] == '\'')
765  {
766  int delim;
767 
768  delim = token_value[0];
769  token_value++;
770  do
771  {
772  line++;
773  }
774  while (line[0] != delim);
775  line[0] = '\0';
776  line++;
777  }
778  else
779  {
780  do
781  {
782  line++;
783  }
784  while (!char_isspace (line[0]));
785  line[0] = '\0';
786  line++;
787  }
788 
789  if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token, "NAME") == 0)
790  {
791  /* Name of volume */
792  ext_name = token_value;
793  }
794  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token, "PATH") == 0)
795  {
796  ext_path = token_value;
797  }
798  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token, "COMMENTS") == 0)
799  {
800  ext_comments = token_value;
801  }
802  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token, "PURPOSE") == 0)
803  {
804  if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token_value, "DATA") == 0)
805  {
806  ext_purpose = DB_PERMANENT_DATA_PURPOSE;
807  }
808  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token_value, "INDEX") == 0)
809  {
810  ext_purpose = DB_PERMANENT_DATA_PURPOSE;
811  }
812  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token_value, "TEMP") == 0)
813  {
814  ext_purpose = DB_TEMPORARY_DATA_PURPOSE;
815  }
816  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token_value, "GENERIC") == 0)
817  {
818  ext_purpose = DB_PERMANENT_DATA_PURPOSE;
819  }
820  else
821  {
822  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_UNKNOWN_PURPOSE, 2, token_value,
823  line_num);
824  error_code = ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_UNKNOWN_PURPOSE;
825  break;
826  }
827  }
828  else if (intl_mbs_casecmp (token, "NPAGES") == 0)
829  {
830  if (sscanf (token_value, "%i", (int *) &ext_npages) != 1)
831  {
832  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_NOGIVEN_NPAGES, 1, line_num);
833  error_code = ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_NOGIVEN_NPAGES;
834  break;
835  }
836  else if (ext_npages <= 0)
837  {
838  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_BAD_NPAGES, 2, ext_npages, line_num);
839  break;
840  }
841  }
842  else
843  {
844  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_UNKNOWN_TOKEN, 2, token, line_num);
845  }
846  }
847 
848  /*
849  * Add the volume
850  */
851  if (error_code != NO_ERROR || (ext_name == NULL && ext_path == NULL && ext_comments == NULL && ext_npages == 0))
852  {
853  continue;
854  }
855 
856  if (ext_npages <= 0)
857  {
858  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_NOGIVEN_NPAGES, 1, line_num);
859  error_code = ER_BO_PARSE_ADDVOLS_NOGIVEN_NPAGES;
860  continue;
861  }
862 
863  error_code =
864  disk_add_volume_extension (thread_p, ext_purpose, ext_npages, ext_path, ext_name, ext_comments, 0, false,
865  &volid);
866  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
867  {
868  ASSERT_ERROR ();
869  break;
870  }
871  assert (volid != NULL_VOLID);
872  }
873  fclose (fp);
874 
875  return error_code;
876 }
877 
878 /*
879  * boot_remove_all_temp_volumes () - remove all temporary volumes from the database
880  *
881  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
882  */
883 static int
884 boot_remove_all_temp_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, REMOVE_TEMP_VOL_ACTION delete_action)
885 {
886  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
887 
888  /* if volumes exist beyond bo_Dbparm.temp_last_volid, we remove the volumes.
889  * there is no logging to add or remove a temporary temp volume, but logging to update bo_Dbparm.
890  * so, unknown volumes can be possible to exist.
891  */
892  if (!BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED ())
893  {
894  boot_remove_unknown_temp_volumes (thread_p);
895  }
896 
897  if (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols == 0)
898  {
899  assert (boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid == NULL_VOLID);
900  return NO_ERROR;
901  }
902 
903  boot_find_rest_temp_volumes (thread_p, NULL_VOLID, boot_xremove_temp_volume, true, true);
904 
905  if (delete_action == ONLY_PHYSICAL_REMOVE_TEMP_VOL_ACTION)
906  {
907  return NO_ERROR;
908  }
909 
910  if (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols != 0 || boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid != NULL_VOLID)
911  {
912  /* something bad happened. Reset it anyway. */
913  boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols = 0;
914  boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid = NULL_VOLID;
915  }
916 
917  error_code = boot_db_parm_update_heap (thread_p);
918  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
919  {
920  ASSERT_ERROR ();
921  return error_code;
922  }
923 
924  return error_code;
925 }
926 
927 /*
928  * boot_xremove_temp_volume () - remove a temporary volume from the database
929  *
930  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
931  *
932  * volid(in): Volume identifier to remove
933  * vlabel(in): Volume label
934  *
935  * Note: Pass control to boot_remove_temp_volume to remove the temporary volume.
936  */
937 static int
938 boot_xremove_temp_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid, const char *vlabel)
939 {
940  return boot_remove_temp_volume (thread_p, volid, vlabel);
941 }
942 
943 static void
944 boot_make_temp_volume_fullname (char *temp_vol_fullname, VOLID temp_volid)
945 {
946  const char *temp_path;
947  const char *temp_name;
948  char *alloc_tempath = NULL;
949 
950  assert (temp_vol_fullname != NULL);
951 
952  temp_vol_fullname[0] = '\0';
953 
954  alloc_tempath = (char *) malloc (strlen (boot_Db_full_name) + 1);
955  if (alloc_tempath == NULL)
956  {
957  return;
958  }
959  temp_path = fileio_get_directory_path (alloc_tempath, boot_Db_full_name);
960  if (temp_path == NULL)
961  {
962  alloc_tempath[0] = '\0';
963  temp_path = alloc_tempath;
964  }
965  temp_name = fileio_get_base_file_name (boot_Db_full_name);
966 
967  fileio_make_volume_temp_name (temp_vol_fullname, temp_path, temp_name, temp_volid);
968 
969  if (alloc_tempath)
970  {
971  free_and_init (alloc_tempath);
972  }
973 }
974 
975 /*
976  * boot_remove_unknown_temp_volumes () -
977  *
978  * return: none
979  */
980 static void
981 boot_remove_unknown_temp_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
982 {
983  VOLID temp_volid;
984  char temp_vol_fullname[PATH_MAX];
985 
986  if (boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid == NULL_VOLID)
987  {
988  temp_volid = LOG_MAX_DBVOLID;
989  }
990  else
991  {
992  temp_volid = boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid - 1;
993  }
994 
995  for (; temp_volid > boot_Db_parm->last_volid; temp_volid--)
996  {
997  boot_make_temp_volume_fullname (temp_vol_fullname, temp_volid);
998  if (!fileio_is_volume_exist (temp_vol_fullname))
999  {
1000  break;
1001  }
1002  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNKNOWN_VOLUME, 1, temp_vol_fullname);
1003  fileio_unformat (thread_p, temp_vol_fullname);
1004  }
1005 }
1006 
1007 /*
1008  * boot_find_rest_volumes () - call function on the rest of vols
1009  *
1010  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
1011  *
1012  * r_args(in): restart argument structure contains various options
1013  * volid(in): Volume identifier
1014  * fun(in): Function to call on volid, vlabel, and arguments
1015  * args(in): Extra arguments for function to call
1016  *
1017  * Note: The given function is called for every single volume which is different from the given one.
1018  */
1019 static int
1020 boot_find_rest_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BO_RESTART_ARG * r_args, VOLID volid,
1021  int (*fun) (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID xvolid, const char *vlabel, void *args), void *args)
1022 {
1023  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
1024  bool check;
1025 
1026  if (r_args != NULL)
1027  {
1028  check = r_args->newvolpath;
1029  }
1030  else
1031  {
1032  check = false;
1033  }
1034 
1035  error_code = boot_find_rest_permanent_volumes (thread_p, check, true, volid, fun, args);
1036  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1037  {
1038  return error_code;
1039  }
1040 
1041  /* We don't want to mount temp vols during bootstrapping,
1042  * since temp vols might be inaccessible for a crash case and will be removed soon.
1043  */
1044 
1045  return error_code;
1046 }
1047 
1048 /*
1049  * boot_find_rest_permanent_volumes () - call function on the rest of permanent vols of database
1050  *
1051  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
1052  *
1053  * newvolpath(in): restore the database and log volumes to the path specified in the database-loc-file.
1054  * use_volinfo(in): use volinfo indicator
1055  * volid(in): Volume identifier
1056  * fun(in): Function to call on volid, vlabel, and arguments
1057  * args(in): Extra arguments for function to call
1058  *
1059  * Note: The given function is called for every single permanent volume which is different from the given one.
1060  */
1061 static int
1062 boot_find_rest_permanent_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool newvolpath, bool use_volinfo, VOLID volid,
1063  int (*fun) (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID xvolid, const char *vlabel, void *args),
1064  void *args)
1065 {
1066  DKNVOLS num_vols = 0;
1067  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
1068 
1069  if (newvolpath || !use_volinfo
1070  || (num_vols = logpb_scan_volume_info (thread_p, NULL, volid, LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID, fun, args)) == -1)
1071  {
1072  /* Don't use volume info .. or could not find volume info .. or it was bad */
1073  VOLID next_volid = LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID; /* Next volume identifier */
1074  char next_vol_fullname[PATH_MAX]; /* Next volume name */
1075 
1076  num_vols = 0;
1077 
1078  /* First the primary volume, then the rest of the volumes */
1079  /*
1080  * Do not assume that all the volumes are mounted. This function may be called to mount the volumes.
1081  * Thus, request to current volume for the next volume instead of going directly through the volume identifier.
1082  */
1083  strcpy (next_vol_fullname, boot_Db_full_name);
1084  for (next_volid = LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID; next_volid != NULL_VOLID;)
1085  {
1086  num_vols++;
1087  if (next_volid != volid)
1088  {
1089  error_code = (*fun) (thread_p, next_volid, next_vol_fullname, args);
1090  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1091  {
1092  return error_code;
1093  }
1094  }
1095  /* update next_volid and next_vol_fullname */
1096  if (disk_get_link (thread_p, next_volid, &next_volid, next_vol_fullname) == NULL)
1097  {
1098  return ER_FAILED;
1099  }
1100  }
1101 
1102  if (use_volinfo == true)
1103  {
1104  /* The volume info was not found.. Recreate it with the current information */
1105  (void) logpb_recreate_volume_info (thread_p);
1106  }
1107  }
1108  else
1109  {
1110  /* Add the volume that was ignored, as long as it is in the range of a valid one */
1111  if (volid != NULL_VOLID && volid >= LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID && volid <= boot_Db_parm->last_volid)
1112  {
1113  num_vols++;
1114  }
1115 
1116  if (num_vols != boot_Db_parm->nvols)
1117  {
1118  error_code = boot_find_rest_permanent_volumes (thread_p, newvolpath, false, volid, fun, args);
1119  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1120  {
1121  /* Still could not mount or find all necessary volumes */
1122  er_set (ER_SYNTAX_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_INCONSISTENT_NPERM_VOLUMES, 2, num_vols,
1123  boot_Db_parm->nvols);
1124  return error_code;
1125  }
1126 
1127  (void) logpb_recreate_volume_info (thread_p);
1128  return NO_ERROR;
1129  }
1130  }
1131 
1132  if (num_vols < boot_Db_parm->nvols)
1133  {
1134  return ER_FAILED;
1135  }
1136 
1137  return error_code;
1138 }
1139 
1140 /*
1141  * bo_find_rest_tempvols () - call function on the rest of temporary vols of the database
1142  *
1143  * volid(in): Volume identifier
1144  * fun(in): Function to call on volid, vlabel, and arguments
1145  * forward_dir(in): direction of accessing the tempvols (forward/backward)
1146  * check_before_access(in): if true, check the existence of volume before access
1147  *
1148  * Note: The given function is called for every single temporary volume which is different from the given one.
1149  */
1150 static void
1151 boot_find_rest_temp_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid,
1152  int (*fun) (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID xvolid, const char *vlabel),
1153  bool forward_dir, bool check_before_access)
1154 {
1155  VOLID temp_volid;
1156  char temp_vol_fullname[PATH_MAX];
1157  const char *temp_path;
1158  const char *temp_name;
1159  char *alloc_tempath = NULL;
1160  int num_vols;
1161  bool go_to_access;
1162 
1163  /*
1164  * Get the name of the extension: ext_path|dbname|"ext"|volid
1165  */
1166 
1167  /* Use the directory where the primary volume is located */
1168  alloc_tempath = (char *) malloc (strlen (boot_Db_full_name) + 1);
1169  if (alloc_tempath == NULL)
1170  {
1171  return;
1172  }
1173  temp_path = fileio_get_directory_path (alloc_tempath, boot_Db_full_name);
1174  if (temp_path == NULL)
1175  {
1176  alloc_tempath[0] = '\0';
1177  temp_path = alloc_tempath;
1178  }
1179  temp_name = fileio_get_base_file_name (boot_Db_full_name);
1180 
1181  if (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols > 0)
1182  {
1183  /* Cycle over all temporarily volumes, skip the given one */
1184  if (forward_dir)
1185  {
1186  for (num_vols = boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid; num_vols <= LOG_MAX_DBVOLID; num_vols++)
1187  {
1188  temp_volid = (VOLID) num_vols;
1189  if (temp_volid != volid)
1190  {
1191  /* Find the name of the volume */
1192  fileio_make_volume_temp_name (temp_vol_fullname, temp_path, temp_name, temp_volid);
1193  go_to_access = false;
1194  if (check_before_access)
1195  {
1196  if (fileio_is_volume_exist (temp_vol_fullname) == true)
1197  {
1198  go_to_access = true;
1199  }
1200  }
1201  else
1202  {
1203  go_to_access = true;
1204  }
1205  if (go_to_access)
1206  { /* Call the function */
1207  (void) (*fun) (thread_p, temp_volid, temp_vol_fullname);
1208  }
1209  }
1210  }
1211  }
1212  else
1213  {
1214  for (num_vols = LOG_MAX_DBVOLID; num_vols >= boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid; num_vols--)
1215  {
1216  temp_volid = (VOLID) num_vols;
1217  if (temp_volid != volid)
1218  {
1219  /* Find the name of the volume */
1220  fileio_make_volume_temp_name (temp_vol_fullname, temp_path, temp_name, temp_volid);
1221  go_to_access = false;
1222  if (check_before_access)
1223  {
1224  if (fileio_is_volume_exist (temp_vol_fullname) == true)
1225  {
1226  go_to_access = true;
1227  }
1228  }
1229  else
1230  {
1231  go_to_access = true;
1232  }
1233  if (go_to_access)
1234  { /* Call the function */
1235  (void) (*fun) (thread_p, temp_volid, temp_vol_fullname);
1236  }
1237  }
1238  }
1239  }
1240  }
1241 
1242  if (alloc_tempath)
1243  {
1244  free_and_init (alloc_tempath);
1245  }
1246 }
1247 
1248 /*
1249  * boot_check_permanent_volumes () - check consistency of permanent volume names and number
1250  *
1251  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
1252  *
1253  * Note: Make sure that we can reach the expected number of volumes
1254  * using the internal link list of permananet volumes.
1255  */
1256 static int
1257 boot_check_permanent_volumes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
1258 {
1259  VOLID num_vols = 0;
1260  VOLID volid = LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID; /* Current volume identifier */
1261  VOLID next_volid = LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID; /* Next volume identifier */
1262  char next_vol_fullname[PATH_MAX]; /* Next volume name */
1263  const char *vlabel;
1264 
1265  /*
1266  * Don't use volinfo .. or could not find volinfo
1267  */
1268 
1269  /* First the primary volume, then the rest of the volumes */
1270  num_vols = 0;
1271  strcpy (next_vol_fullname, boot_Db_full_name);
1272 
1273  /*
1274  * Do not assume that all the volumes are mounted. This function may be
1275  * called to mount the volumes. Thus, request to current volume for the
1276  * next volume instead of going directly through the volume identifier.
1277  */
1278  do
1279  {
1280  num_vols++;
1281  /* Have to make sure a label exists, before we try to use it below */
1282  vlabel = fileio_get_volume_label (volid, PEEK);
1283  if (vlabel == NULL)
1284  {
1285  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_GENERIC_ERROR, 0);
1286  return ER_GENERIC_ERROR;
1287  }
1288 
1289  if (util_compare_filepath (next_vol_fullname, vlabel) != 0)
1290  {
1291  /*
1292  * Names are different. The database was renamed outside the domain of
1293  * the database (e.g., in Unix), or this is not a database.
1294  * If volume information is not present, assume that this is not a
1295  * database
1296  */
1297  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_NOT_A_VOLUME, 1, vlabel);
1298  }
1299  if (disk_get_link (thread_p, volid, &next_volid, next_vol_fullname) == NULL)
1300  {
1301  return ER_GENERIC_ERROR;
1302  }
1303 
1304  volid = next_volid;
1305  }
1306  while (volid != NULL_VOLID);
1307 
1308  if (num_vols != boot_Db_parm->nvols)
1309  {
1310  er_set (ER_SYNTAX_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_INCONSISTENT_NPERM_VOLUMES, 2, num_vols,
1311  boot_Db_parm->nvols);
1312  return ER_BO_INCONSISTENT_NPERM_VOLUMES;
1313  }
1314 
1315  return NO_ERROR;
1316 }
1317 
1318 /*
1319  * boot_mount () - mount given volume
1320  *
1321  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
1322  *
1323  * volid(in): Volume identifier
1324  * vlabel(in): Volume label
1325  * arg_ignore: Unused
1326  */
1327 static int
1328 boot_mount (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, VOLID volid, const char *vlabel, void *ignore_arg)
1329 {
1330  char check_vlabel[PATH_MAX];
1331  int vdes;
1332 
1333  vdes = fileio_mount (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, vlabel, volid, false, false);
1334  if (vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
1335  {
1336  return ER_FAILED;
1337  }
1338 
1339  /* Check the label and give a warning if labels are not the same */
1340  if (xdisk_get_fullname (thread_p, volid, check_vlabel) == NULL)
1341  {
1342  fileio_dismount (thread_p, vdes);
1343  return ER_FAILED;
1344  }
1345 
1346  if (util_compare_filepath (check_vlabel, vlabel) != 0)
1347  {
1348  /*
1349  * Names are different. The database was renamed outside the domain of
1350  * the database (e.g., in Unix), or this is not a database.
1351  * If volume information is not present, assume that this is not a
1352  * database
1353  */
1354  if (!logpb_find_volume_info_exist ())
1355  {
1356  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_NOT_A_VOLUME, 1, vlabel);
1357  return ER_BO_NOT_A_VOLUME;
1358  }
1359  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_NOT_A_VOLUME, 1, vlabel);
1360  }
1361 
1362  return NO_ERROR;
1363 }
1364 
1365 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1366 static jmp_buf boot_Init_server_jmpbuf;
1367 #endif
1368 
1369 static bool boot_Init_server_is_canceled = false;
1370 
1371 /*
1372  * boot_ctrl_c_in_init_server () -
1373  *
1374  * return:
1375  */
1376 static void
1377 boot_ctrl_c_in_init_server (int ignore_signo)
1378 {
1379 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1380  _longjmp (boot_Init_server_jmpbuf, 1);
1381 #else
1382  boot_Init_server_is_canceled = true;
1383 #endif
1384 }
1385 
1386 /*
1387  * xboot_initialize_server () - initialize server
1388  *
1389  * return : transaction index or NULL_TRAN_INDEX in the case of
1390  * error.
1391  *
1392  * print_version(in): Flag which indicates if the version of CUBRID server
1393  * is printed at the end of the initialization process.
1394  * db_name(in): Database Name
1395  * db_path(in): Directory where the database is created. It allows you
1396  * to specify the exact pathname of a directory in which
1397  * to create the new database. A NULL value is invalid.
1398  * db_comments(in): Database creation comments such as name of the user who
1399  * created the database, the date of the creation,the name
1400  * of the intended application, or nothing at all. NULL
1401  * can be passed if no comments are desired.
1402  * db_npages(in): Total number of pages to allocate for the database.
1403  * db_overwrite(in): Wheater to overwrite the database if it already exists.
1404  * file_addmore_vols(in): More volumes are created during the initialization
1405  * process.
1406  * log_path(in): Directory where the log and backups of the database are
1407  * created. We recommend placing log and backup in a
1408  * different directory and disk device from the directory
1409  * and disk device of the data volumes. A NULL value is
1410  * invalid.
1411  * db_server_host(in): Server host where the database will reside. The host is
1412  * needed in a client/server environment to identify the
1413  * server which will maintain (e.g., restart) the database
1414  * A NULL is invalid.
1415  * rootclass_oid(in): OID of root class (Set as a side effect)
1416  * rootclass_hfid(in): Heap for classes (Set as a side effect)
1417  * client_prog_name(in): Name of the client program or NULL
1418  * client_user_name(in): Name of the client user or NULL
1419  * client_host_name(in): Name of the client host or NULL
1420  * client_process_id(in): Identifier of the process of the host where the client
1421  * client transaction runs.
1422  * client_lock_wait(in): Wait for at least this number of milliseconds to acquire a
1423  * lock. Negative value is infinite
1424  * client_isolation(in): Isolation level. One of the following:
1425  * TRAN_REPEATABLE_READ
1426  * TRAN_READ_COMMITTED
1427  * TRAN_SERIALIZABLE
1428  * db_desired_pagesize(in): Desired pagesize for the new database. The given size
1429  * must be power of 2 and greater or equal than 512.
1430  *
1431  * Note: The first step of any CUBRID application is to initialize a
1432  * database. A database is composed of data volumes (or Unix file
1433  * system files), database backup files, and log files. A data
1434  * volume contains information on attributes, classes, indexes,
1435  * and objects created in the database. A database backup is a
1436  * fuzzy snapshot of the entire database. The backup is fuzzy
1437  * since it can be taken online when other transactions are
1438  * updating the database. The logs contain records that reflects
1439  * changes to the database. The log and backup files are used by
1440  * the system to recover committed and uncommitted transactions
1441  * in the event of system and media crashes. Logs are also used
1442  * to support user-initiated rollbacks.
1443  *
1444  * The rest of this function is identical to the restart. A
1445  * transaction for the current client session is automatically
1446  * started.
1447  */
1448 int
1449 xboot_initialize_server (const BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL * client_credential, BOOT_DB_PATH_INFO * db_path_info,
1450  bool db_overwrite, const char *file_addmore_vols, volatile DKNPAGES db_npages,
1451  PGLENGTH db_desired_pagesize, volatile DKNPAGES log_npages, PGLENGTH db_desired_log_page_size,
1452  OID * rootclass_oid, HFID * rootclass_hfid, int client_lock_wait,
1453  TRAN_ISOLATION client_isolation)
1454 {
1455  int tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1456  const char *log_prefix = NULL;
1457  DB_INFO *db = NULL;
1458  DB_INFO *dir = NULL;
1459  int dbtxt_vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
1460  char db_pathbuf[PATH_MAX];
1461  char vol_real_path[PATH_MAX];
1462  char log_pathbuf[PATH_MAX];
1463  char lob_pathbuf[LOB_PATH_PREFIX_MAX + PATH_MAX];
1464  char dbtxt_label[PATH_MAX];
1465  char fixed_pathbuf[PATH_MAX];
1466  char original_namebuf[PATH_MAX];
1467 #if defined (NDEBUG)
1468  char format[BOOT_FORMAT_MAX_LENGTH];
1469 #endif
1470  int error_code;
1471  void (*old_ctrl_c_handler) (int sig_no) = SIG_ERR;
1472  struct stat stat_buf;
1473  bool is_exist_volume;
1474  char *db_path, *log_path, *lob_path, *p;
1475  THREAD_ENTRY *thread_p = NULL;
1476 
1477  assert (client_credential != NULL);
1478  assert (db_path_info != NULL);
1479 
1480 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1481  if (lang_init () != NO_ERROR)
1482  {
1483  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
1484  {
1485  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOC_INIT, 1, "Failed to initialize language module");
1486  }
1487  goto exit_on_error;
1488  }
1489 
1490  /* initialize time zone data, optional module */
1491  if (tz_load () != NO_ERROR)
1492  {
1493  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
1494  {
1495  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR, 1, "Failed to initialize timezone module");
1496  }
1497  goto exit_on_error;
1498  }
1499 
1500  /* open the system message catalog, before prm_ ? */
1501  if (msgcat_init () != NO_ERROR)
1502  {
1503  /* need an appropriate error */
1504  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_ACCESS_MESSAGE_CATALOG, 0);
1505  goto exit_on_error;
1506  }
1507 
1508  if (sysprm_load_and_init (NULL, NULL, SYSPRM_LOAD_ALL) != NO_ERROR)
1509  {
1510  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANT_LOAD_SYSPRM, 0);
1511  goto exit_on_error;
1512  }
1513 
1514  area_init ();
1515  error_code = set_area_init ();
1516  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1517  {
1518  goto exit_on_error;
1519  }
1520  error_code = pr_area_init ();
1521  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1522  {
1523  goto exit_on_error;
1524  }
1525  error_code = tp_init ();
1526  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1527  {
1528  goto exit_on_error;
1529  }
1530 
1531  /* Initialize tsc-timer */
1532  tsc_init ();
1533 
1534  /* Clear error structure */
1535  er_clear ();
1536 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1537 
1538 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1539  if ((int) strlen (ROOTCLASS_NAME) > DB_SIZEOF (boot_Db_parm->rootclass_name))
1540  {
1541  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNABLE_TO_RESTART_SERVER, 1, ROOTCLASS_NAME);
1542  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
1543  "xboot_initialize_server: ** SYSTEM COMPILATION ERROR **"
1544  " Length (i.e., %d) of ROOTCLASS_NAME(i.e, %s) is bigger than"
1545  " length (i.e., %d) of bo_Dbparm->rootclass_name field", strlen (ROOTCLASS_NAME) + 1,
1546  ROOTCLASS_NAME, DB_SIZEOF (boot_Db_parm->rootclass_name));
1547  /* Destroy everything */
1548  goto exit_on_error;
1549  }
1550 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1551 
1552  if (client_credential->db_name == NULL)
1553  {
1554  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNKNOWN_DATABASE, 1, client_credential->db_name);
1555  goto exit_on_error;
1556  }
1557 
1558  /*
1559  * Make sure that the db_path and log_path and lob_path are the canonicalized
1560  * absolute pathnames
1561  */
1562 
1563  memset (db_pathbuf, 0, sizeof (db_pathbuf));
1564  memset (log_pathbuf, 0, sizeof (log_pathbuf));
1565  memset (lob_pathbuf, 0, sizeof (lob_pathbuf));
1566 
1567  /*
1568  * for db path,
1569  * convert to absolute path, remove useless PATH_SEPARATOR
1570  */
1571  db_path = db_path_info->db_path;
1572  if (realpath (db_path, fixed_pathbuf) != NULL)
1573  {
1574  db_path = fixed_pathbuf;
1575  }
1576  else
1577  {
1578  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_DIRECTORY_DOESNOT_EXIST, 1, db_path);
1579  goto exit_on_error;
1580  }
1581  boot_remove_useless_path_separator (db_path, db_pathbuf);
1582  db_path = db_pathbuf;
1583 
1584  /*
1585  * for log path,
1586  * convert to absolute path, remove useless PATH_SEPARATOR
1587  */
1588  log_path = db_path_info->log_path;
1589  if (realpath (log_path, fixed_pathbuf) != NULL)
1590  {
1591  log_path = fixed_pathbuf;
1592  }
1593  else
1594  {
1595  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_DIRECTORY_DOESNOT_EXIST, 1, log_path);
1596  goto exit_on_error;
1597  }
1598  boot_remove_useless_path_separator (log_path, log_pathbuf);
1599  log_path = log_pathbuf;
1600 
1601  /*
1602  * for lob path,
1603  * convert to absolute path, remove useless PATH_SEPARATOR
1604  */
1605  lob_path = db_path_info->lob_path;
1606  if (es_get_type (lob_path) == ES_NONE)
1607  {
1608  snprintf (lob_pathbuf, sizeof (lob_pathbuf), "%s%s", LOB_PATH_DEFAULT_PREFIX, lob_path);
1609  p = lob_path = strchr (lob_pathbuf, ':') + 1;
1610  }
1611  else
1612  {
1613  p = lob_path = strchr (strcpy (lob_pathbuf, lob_path), ':') + 1;
1614  }
1615 
1616  if (lob_path == NULL)
1617  {
1618  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_ES_INVALID_PATH, 1, lob_pathbuf);
1619  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1620  }
1621 
1622  if (es_get_type (lob_pathbuf) == ES_POSIX)
1623  {
1624 #if defined (WINDOWS)
1625  if (realpath (lob_path, fixed_pathbuf) != NULL
1626  && (stat (fixed_pathbuf, &stat_buf) == 0 && S_ISDIR (stat_buf.st_mode)))
1627 #else
1628  if (realpath (lob_path, fixed_pathbuf) != NULL)
1629 #endif
1630  {
1631  lob_path = fixed_pathbuf;
1632  }
1633  else
1634  {
1635  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_DIRECTORY_DOESNOT_EXIST, 1, lob_path);
1636  if (mkdir (lob_path, 0777) < 0)
1637  {
1638  cub_dirname_r (lob_path, fixed_pathbuf, PATH_MAX);
1639  er_set_with_oserror (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_ES_GENERAL, 2, "POSIX", fixed_pathbuf);
1640  goto exit_on_error;
1641  }
1642  }
1643  boot_remove_useless_path_separator (lob_path, p);
1644  }
1645  lob_path = lob_pathbuf;
1646 
1647  /*
1648  * Compose the full name of the database
1649  */
1650  snprintf (boot_Db_full_name, sizeof (boot_Db_full_name), "%s%c%s", db_path, PATH_SEPARATOR,
1651  client_credential->db_name);
1652 
1653  /*
1654  * Initialize error structure, critical section, slotted page, heap, and
1655  * recovery managers
1656  */
1657 
1658 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1659  sysprm_load_and_init (boot_Db_full_name, NULL, SYSPRM_LOAD_ALL);
1660 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1661 
1662  /* If the server is already restarted, shutdown the server */
1663  if (BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED ())
1664  {
1665  // not sure this can be true
1666  if (thread_p == NULL)
1667  {
1668  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
1669  }
1670  (void) xboot_shutdown_server (thread_p, ER_ALL_FINAL);
1671  assert (thread_p == NULL);
1672  }
1673 
1674  log_prefix = fileio_get_base_file_name (client_credential->db_name);
1675 
1676  /*
1677  * Find logging information to create the log volume. If the page size is
1678  * not the same as the one in production mode, adjust the number of pages
1679  * allocated.
1680  */
1681 
1682  if (db_npages <= 0)
1683  {
1684  db_npages = (DKNPAGES) (prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_DB_VOLUME_SIZE) / db_desired_pagesize);
1685  }
1686 
1687  if (log_npages <= 0)
1688  {
1689  log_npages = (DKNPAGES) (prm_get_bigint_value (PRM_ID_LOG_VOLUME_SIZE) / db_desired_log_page_size);
1690  }
1691 
1692  if (log_npages < 10)
1693  {
1694  log_npages = 10;
1695  }
1696 
1697  /* *INDENT-OFF* */
1698  cubthread::initialize (thread_p);
1699  error_code = cubthread::initialize_thread_entries ();
1700  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1701  {
1702  ASSERT_ERROR ();
1703  goto exit_on_error;
1704  }
1705  /* *INDENT-ON* */
1706 
1707  /*
1708  * get the database directory information in write mode.
1709  */
1710 
1711  if (cfg_maycreate_get_directory_filename (dbtxt_label) == NULL
1712 #if !defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS)
1713 /* Temporary fix for NT file locking problem */
1714  || (dbtxt_vdes = fileio_mount (thread_p, dbtxt_label, dbtxt_label, LOG_DBTXT_VOLID, 2, true)) == NULL_VOLDES
1715 #endif /* !WINDOWS || DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS */
1716  )
1717  {
1718  goto exit_on_error;
1719  }
1720 
1721  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1722  {
1723  if (cfg_read_directory_ex (dbtxt_vdes, &dir, true) != NO_ERROR)
1724  {
1725  goto exit_on_error;
1726  }
1727  }
1728  else
1729  {
1730  if (cfg_read_directory (&dir, true) != NO_ERROR)
1731  {
1732  goto exit_on_error;
1733  }
1734  }
1735 
1736  if (dir != NULL && ((db = cfg_find_db_list (dir, client_credential->db_name)) != NULL))
1737  {
1738  if (db_overwrite == false)
1739  {
1740  /* There is a database with the same name and we cannot overwrite it */
1741  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_DATABASE_EXISTS, 1, client_credential->db_name);
1742  goto exit_on_error;
1743  }
1744  else
1745  {
1746  /*
1747  * Delete the database.. to make sure that all backups, log archives, and
1748  * so on are removed... then continue...
1749  *
1750  * Note: we do not call xboot_delete since it shuttdown the system and
1751  * update database.txt that we have a read copy of its content.
1752  */
1753 
1754  /* Note: for database replacement, we need to remove the old database with its original path! */
1755  memset (original_namebuf, 0, sizeof (original_namebuf));
1756 
1757  /* Compose the original full name of the database */
1758  snprintf (original_namebuf, sizeof (original_namebuf), "%s%c%s", db->pathname, PATH_SEPARATOR, db->name);
1759 
1760  error_code = boot_remove_all_volumes (thread_p, original_namebuf, db->logpath, log_prefix, false, true);
1761  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1762  {
1763  goto exit_on_error;
1764  }
1765  }
1766  }
1767 
1768  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1769  {
1770  fileio_dismount (thread_p, dbtxt_vdes); /* unlock the directory file */
1771  dbtxt_vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
1772  cfg_free_directory (dir);
1773  dir = NULL;
1774  }
1775 
1776  error_code =
1777  logpb_check_exist_any_volumes (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, log_path, log_prefix, vol_real_path, &is_exist_volume);
1778  if (error_code != NO_ERROR || is_exist_volume)
1779  {
1780  goto exit_on_error;
1781  }
1782 
1783 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1784  if (db_path_info->vol_path != NULL)
1785  {
1786  if (realpath ((char *) db_path_info->vol_path, vol_real_path) == NULL)
1787  {
1788  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_CREATE_LINK, 2, vol_real_path, boot_Db_full_name);
1789  goto exit_on_error;
1790  }
1791  else
1792  {
1793  if (stat (vol_real_path, &stat_buf) != 0 /* file not exist */
1794  || S_ISDIR (stat_buf.st_mode))
1795  { /* is directory */
1796  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_CREATE_LINK, 2, vol_real_path, boot_Db_full_name);
1797  goto exit_on_error;
1798  }
1799  (void) unlink (boot_Db_full_name);
1800  if (symlink (vol_real_path, boot_Db_full_name) != 0)
1801  {
1802  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_CREATE_LINK, 2, vol_real_path, boot_Db_full_name);
1803  goto exit_on_error;
1804  }
1805  }
1806  }
1807 #endif /* !WINDOWS */
1808 
1809  (void) db_set_page_size (db_desired_pagesize, db_desired_log_page_size);
1810 
1811  if ((int) strlen (boot_Db_full_name) > DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH - 1)
1812  {
1813  /* db_path + db_name is too long */
1814  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_FULL_DATABASE_NAME_IS_TOO_LONG, 4, db_path,
1815  client_credential->db_name, strlen (boot_Db_full_name), DB_MAX_PATH_LENGTH - 1);
1816  goto exit_on_error;
1817  }
1818 
1819  old_ctrl_c_handler = os_set_signal_handler (SIGINT, boot_ctrl_c_in_init_server);
1820 
1821 #if !defined(WINDOWS)
1822  boot_Init_server_is_canceled = (_setjmp (boot_Init_server_jmpbuf) != 0);
1823 #endif
1824 
1825  if (!boot_Init_server_is_canceled)
1826  {
1827  tran_index =
1828  boot_create_all_volumes (thread_p, client_credential, db_path_info->db_comments, db_npages, file_addmore_vols,
1829  log_path, (const char *) log_prefix, log_npages, client_lock_wait, client_isolation);
1830 
1831  if (tran_index != NULL_TRAN_INDEX && !boot_Init_server_is_canceled)
1832  {
1833 #if !defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS)
1834  dbtxt_vdes = fileio_mount (thread_p, dbtxt_label, dbtxt_label, LOG_DBTXT_VOLID, 2, true);
1835  if (dbtxt_vdes == NULL_VOLDES)
1836  {
1837  goto exit_on_error;
1838  }
1839 #endif /* !WINDOWS || !DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS */
1840 
1841  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1842  {
1843  if (cfg_read_directory_ex (dbtxt_vdes, &dir, true) != NO_ERROR)
1844  {
1845  goto exit_on_error;
1846  }
1847  }
1848  else
1849  {
1850  if (cfg_read_directory (&dir, true) != NO_ERROR)
1851  {
1852  goto exit_on_error;
1853  }
1854  }
1855 
1856  db = cfg_find_db_list (dir, client_credential->db_name);
1857 
1858  /* Now create the entry in the database table */
1859  if (db == NULL)
1860  {
1861  db = cfg_add_db (&dir, client_credential->db_name, db_path, log_path, lob_path, db_path_info->db_host);
1862  }
1863  else
1864  {
1865  cfg_update_db (db, db_path, log_path, lob_path, db_path_info->db_host);
1866  }
1867 
1868  if (db == NULL || db->name == NULL || db->pathname == NULL || db->logpath == NULL || db->lobpath == NULL
1869  || db->hosts == NULL)
1870  {
1871  goto exit_on_error;
1872  }
1873 
1874 #if defined(WINDOWS) && !defined(DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS)
1875  /* Under Windows/NT, it appears that locking a file prevents a subsequent open for write by the same process.
1876  * The cfg_write_directory will never succeed as long as the file is "mounted" by fileio_mount(). To allow
1877  * the cubrid.db file to be updated, dismount before calling cfg_. Note that this leaves an extremely small
1878  * windows where another process could steal our lock. */
1879  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1880  {
1881  fileio_dismount (thread_p, dbtxt_vdes);
1882  dbtxt_vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
1883  }
1884 #endif /* WINDOWS && !DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS */
1885 
1886  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1887  {
1888  cfg_write_directory_ex (dbtxt_vdes, dir);
1889  }
1890  else
1891  {
1892  cfg_write_directory (dir);
1893  }
1894  cfg_free_directory (dir);
1895  dir = NULL;
1896 
1897  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1898  {
1899  fileio_dismount (thread_p, dbtxt_vdes);
1900  dbtxt_vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
1901  }
1902  }
1903  }
1904 
1905  if (tran_index == NULL_TRAN_INDEX || boot_Init_server_is_canceled)
1906  {
1907  (void) boot_remove_all_volumes (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, log_path, (const char *) log_prefix, true, true);
1908  if (boot_Init_server_is_canceled)
1909  {
1910  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INTERRUPTED, 0);
1911  }
1912  else
1913  {
1914  if (db_path_info->vol_path != NULL)
1915  {
1916  (void) unlink (boot_Db_full_name);
1917  }
1918  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_CREATE_VOL, 3, "volumes", client_credential->db_name,
1919  er_get_msglog_filename ());
1920  }
1921 
1922  goto exit_on_error;
1923  }
1924 
1925  rootclass_oid->volid = boot_Db_parm->rootclass_oid.volid;
1926  rootclass_oid->pageid = boot_Db_parm->rootclass_oid.pageid;
1927  rootclass_oid->slotid = boot_Db_parm->rootclass_oid.slotid;
1928  if (boot_find_root_heap (rootclass_hfid) != NO_ERROR || HFID_IS_NULL (rootclass_hfid))
1929  {
1930  goto exit_on_error;
1931  }
1932 
1933  // sessions state is required to continue
1934  error_code = session_states_init (thread_p);
1935  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
1936  {
1937  assert (false);
1938  goto exit_on_error;
1939  }
1940 
1941  /* print_version string */
1942 #if defined (NDEBUG)
1943  strncpy (format, msgcat_message (MSGCAT_CATALOG_CUBRID, MSGCAT_SET_GENERAL, MSGCAT_GENERAL_DATABASE_INIT),
1944  BOOT_FORMAT_MAX_LENGTH);
1945  fprintf (stdout, format, rel_name (), rel_build_number ());
1946 #else /* NDEBUG */
1947  fprintf (stdout, "\n%s (%s) (%d debug build)\n\n", rel_name (), rel_build_number (), rel_bit_platform ());
1948 #endif /* !NDEBUG */
1949 
1950  if (old_ctrl_c_handler != SIG_ERR)
1951  {
1952  (void) os_set_signal_handler (SIGINT, old_ctrl_c_handler);
1953  }
1954 
1955  return tran_index;
1956 
1957 exit_on_error:
1958 
1959  if (old_ctrl_c_handler != SIG_ERR)
1960  {
1961  (void) os_set_signal_handler (SIGINT, old_ctrl_c_handler);
1962  }
1963 
1964  /* Destroy everything */
1965  if (dir)
1966  {
1967  cfg_free_directory (dir);
1968  }
1969 
1970  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
1971  {
1972  fileio_dismount (thread_p, dbtxt_vdes);
1973  }
1974 
1975  if (tran_index != NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
1976  {
1977  logtb_release_tran_index (thread_p, tran_index);
1978  log_final (thread_p);
1979  }
1980 
1981  er_stack_push ();
1982  boot_server_all_finalize (thread_p, ER_THREAD_FINAL, BOOT_SHUTDOWN_EXCEPT_COMMON_MODULES);
1983  er_stack_pop ();
1984 
1985  // and now finalize thread entry
1986  cubthread::finalize ();
1987 
1988  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1989 }
1990 
1991 static int
1992 boot_make_session_server_key (void)
1993 {
1994  int err;
1995  UINT32 t;
1996  unsigned char ip[4];
1997 
1998  t = (UINT32) time (NULL);
1999  memcpy (boot_Server_session_key, &t, sizeof (UINT32));
2000  err = css_hostname_to_ip (boot_Host_name, ip);
2001  if (err != NO_ERROR)
2002  {
2003  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2004  return err;
2005  }
2006  boot_Server_session_key[4] = ip[0];
2007  boot_Server_session_key[5] = ip[1];
2008  boot_Server_session_key[6] = ip[2];
2009  boot_Server_session_key[7] = ip[3];
2010  return NO_ERROR;
2011 }
2012 
2013 /*
2014  * boot_restart_server () - restart server
2015  *
2016  * return : NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
2017  *
2018  * print_restart(in): Flag which indicates if the version of CUBRID server
2019  * is printed at the end of the restart process.
2020  * db_name(in): Database Name
2021  * from_backup(in): Execute the restart from a backup..
2022  * check_db_coll(in): True if check DB collations with system collations
2023  * r_args(in): restart argument structure contains various options
2024  *
2025  * Note: The CUBRID server is restarted. Recovery process, no
2026  * related to media failures (i.e., disk crashes), takes place
2027  * during the restart process.
2028  */
2029 int
2030 boot_restart_server (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool print_restart, const char *db_name, bool from_backup,
2031  CHECK_ARGS * check_coll_and_timezone, BO_RESTART_ARG * r_args)
2032 {
2033  char log_path[PATH_MAX];
2034  const char *log_prefix;
2035  DB_INFO *db = NULL;
2036  DB_INFO *dir = NULL;
2037 #if defined (NDEBUG)
2038  char format[BOOT_FORMAT_MAX_LENGTH];
2039 #endif
2040  int tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2041  int dbtxt_vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
2042  char dbtxt_label[PATH_MAX];
2043 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2044  HA_MODE common_ha_mode;
2045 #endif
2046  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
2047  char *prev_err_msg;
2048  INTL_CODESET db_charset_db_header = INTL_CODESET_NONE;
2049  INTL_CODESET db_charset_db_root = INTL_CODESET_NONE;
2050  char db_lang[LANG_MAX_LANGNAME + 1];
2051  char timezone_checksum[32 + 1];
2052  const TZ_DATA *tzd;
2053 
2054  /* language data is loaded in context of server */
2055  if (lang_init () != NO_ERROR)
2056  {
2057  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
2058  {
2059  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOC_INIT, 1, "Failed to initialize language module");
2060  }
2061  error_code = ER_LOC_INIT;
2062  goto error;
2063  }
2064 
2065  /* initialize time zone data, optional module */
2066  if (tz_load () != NO_ERROR)
2067  {
2068  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
2069  {
2070  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR, 1, "Failed to initialize timezone module");
2071  }
2072  error_code = ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR;
2073  goto error;
2074  }
2075 
2076  if (msgcat_init () != NO_ERROR)
2077  {
2078  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_ACCESS_MESSAGE_CATALOG, 0);
2079  error_code = ER_BO_CANNOT_ACCESS_MESSAGE_CATALOG;
2080  goto error;
2081  }
2082 
2083 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2084  if (sysprm_load_and_init (NULL, NULL, SYSPRM_LOAD_ALL) != NO_ERROR)
2085  {
2086  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANT_LOAD_SYSPRM, 0);
2087  error_code = ER_BO_CANT_LOAD_SYSPRM;
2088  goto error;
2089  }
2090 
2091  common_ha_mode = HA_GET_MODE ();
2092 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2093 
2094  if (db_name == NULL)
2095  {
2096  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNKNOWN_DATABASE, 1, db_name);
2097  error_code = ER_BO_UNKNOWN_DATABASE;
2098  goto error;
2099  }
2100 
2101  /*
2102  * Make sure that there is a database.txt and that the desired database
2103  * exists. We do not want to lock the database.txt at this point since we
2104  * are only reading it. However, if we do not find the desired database,
2105  * we must lock the file to make sure that we got a consistent view of
2106  * database.txt (database.txt is written from scratch when it is updated).
2107  * That is, don't complain that a database does not exist until we have
2108  * a lock of database.txt
2109  */
2110 
2111  if (cfg_read_directory (&dir, false) != NO_ERROR)
2112  {
2113  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
2114  {
2115  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CFG_NO_FILE, 1, DATABASES_FILENAME);
2116  }
2117  error_code = ER_CFG_NO_FILE;
2118  goto error;
2119  }
2120 
2121  if (dir == NULL || ((db = cfg_find_db_list (dir, db_name)) == NULL))
2122  {
2123  /*
2124  * Make sure that nobody was in the process of writing the
2125  * database.txt when we got a snapshot of it.
2126  */
2127  if (dir != NULL)
2128  {
2129  cfg_free_directory (dir);
2130  dir = NULL;
2131  }
2132 
2133  if (cfg_maycreate_get_directory_filename (dbtxt_label) != NULL
2134 #if !defined(WINDOWS) || !defined(DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS)
2135 /* Temporary fix for NT file locking problem */
2136  && (dbtxt_vdes = fileio_mount (thread_p, dbtxt_label, dbtxt_label, LOG_DBTXT_VOLID, 2, true)) != NULL_VOLDES
2137 #endif /* !WINDOWS || !DONT_USE_MANDATORY_LOCK_IN_WINDOWS */
2138  )
2139  {
2140  if (dbtxt_vdes != NULL_VOLDES)
2141  {
2142  if (cfg_read_directory_ex (dbtxt_vdes, &dir, false) == NO_ERROR)
2143  {
2144  db = cfg_find_db_list (dir, db_name);
2145  }
2146  }
2147  else
2148  {
2149  if (cfg_read_directory (&dir, false) == NO_ERROR)
2150  {
2151  db = cfg_find_db_list (dir, db_name);
2152  }
2153  }
2154 
2155  fileio_dismount (thread_p, dbtxt_vdes);
2156  dbtxt_vdes = NULL_VOLDES;
2157  }
2158  if (db == NULL)
2159  {
2160  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNKNOWN_DATABASE, 1, db_name);
2161  error_code = ER_BO_UNKNOWN_DATABASE;
2162  goto error;
2163  }
2164  }
2165 
2166  if (GETHOSTNAME (boot_Host_name, MAXHOSTNAMELEN) != 0)
2167  {
2168  strcpy (boot_Host_name, "(unknown)");
2169  }
2170  boot_Host_name[MAXHOSTNAMELEN - 1] = '\0'; /* bullet proof */
2171 
2172  COMPOSE_FULL_NAME (boot_Db_full_name, sizeof (boot_Db_full_name), db->pathname, db_name);
2173  error_code = boot_make_session_server_key ();
2174  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2175  {
2176  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2177  goto error;
2178  }
2179 
2180  if (boot_volume_info_log_path (log_path) == NULL)
2181  {
2182  strcpy (log_path, db->logpath);
2183  }
2184 
2185  if (db->lobpath != NULL)
2186  {
2187  strlcpy (boot_Lob_path, db->lobpath, sizeof (boot_Lob_path));
2188  }
2189  else
2190  {
2191  boot_Lob_path[0] = '\0';
2192  }
2193 
2194  /*
2195  * Initialize error structure, critical section, slotted page, heap, and
2196  * recovery managers
2197  */
2198 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2199  if (sysprm_load_and_init (boot_Db_full_name, NULL, SYSPRM_LOAD_ALL) != NO_ERROR)
2200  {
2201  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANT_LOAD_SYSPRM, 0);
2202  error_code = ER_BO_CANT_LOAD_SYSPRM;
2203  goto error;
2204  }
2205 
2206  if (common_ha_mode != prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_HA_MODE) && !HA_DISABLED ())
2207  {
2208  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_PRM_CONFLICT_EXISTS_ON_MULTIPLE_SECTIONS, 6, "cubrid.conf", "common",
2209  prm_get_name (PRM_ID_HA_MODE), css_ha_mode_string (common_ha_mode), db_name,
2210  css_ha_mode_string (HA_GET_MODE ()));
2211  error_code = ER_PRM_CONFLICT_EXISTS_ON_MULTIPLE_SECTIONS;
2212  goto error;
2213  }
2214 
2215  /* reinit msg catalog to reflect PRM_MAX_THREADS */
2216  msgcat_final ();
2217  if (msgcat_init () != NO_ERROR)
2218  {
2219  error_code = ER_BO_CANNOT_ACCESS_MESSAGE_CATALOG;
2220  goto error;
2221  }
2222 
2223  error_code = css_init_conn_list ();
2224  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2225  {
2226  goto error;
2227  }
2228 
2229  error_code = perfmon_initialize (MAX_NTRANS);
2230  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2231  {
2232  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2233  goto error;
2234  }
2235 
2236  /* note that thread entry was re-initialized */
2237  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
2238  assert (thread_p != NULL);
2239 
2240  if (er_init (prm_get_string_value (PRM_ID_ER_LOG_FILE), prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_ER_EXIT_ASK)) != NO_ERROR)
2241  {
2242  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2243  goto error;
2244  }
2245  er_clear ();
2246 
2247  event_log_init (db_name);
2248 
2249  /* initialize allocations areas for things we need, on the client, most of this is done inside ws_init(). */
2250  area_init ();
2251  error_code = set_area_init ();
2252  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2253  {
2254  goto error;
2255  }
2256  error_code = pr_area_init ();
2257  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2258  {
2259  goto error;
2260  }
2261 
2262  locator_initialize_areas ();
2263 
2264  /* initialize the type/doain module (also sets up an area) */
2265  error_code = tp_init ();
2266  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2267  {
2268  goto error;
2269  }
2270 
2271  /* Initialize tsc-timer */
2272  tsc_init ();
2273 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
2274 
2275  // Initialize java stored procedure server
2276  error_code = jsp_start_server (db_name, db->pathname);
2277  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2278  {
2279  goto error;
2280  }
2281 
2282  /* *INDENT-OFF* */
2283 #if defined (SA_MODE)
2284  // thread_manager was not initialized
2285  assert (thread_p == NULL);
2286  cubthread::initialize (thread_p);
2287  assert (thread_p == thread_get_thread_entry_info ());
2288 #endif // SA_MODE
2289  error_code = cubthread::initialize_thread_entries ();
2290  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2291  {
2292  goto error;
2293  }
2294  /* *INDENT-ON* */
2295 
2296  pr_Enable_string_compression = prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_ENABLE_STRING_COMPRESSION);
2297 
2298  /*
2299  * Compose the full name of the database and find location of logs
2300  */
2301 
2302  log_prefix = fileio_get_base_file_name (db_name);
2303 
2304  /* The database pagesize is set by log_get_io_page_size */
2305 
2306  if (log_get_io_page_size (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, log_path, log_prefix) == -1)
2307  {
2308  if (from_backup == false || er_errid () == ER_IO_MOUNT_LOCKED)
2309  {
2310  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2311  goto error;
2312  }
2313  }
2314 
2315  /* Initialize the transaction table */
2316  logtb_define_trantable (thread_p, -1, -1);
2317 
2318  /*
2319  * How to restart the system ?
2320  */
2321  if (from_backup != false)
2322  {
2323  /*
2324  * RESTART FROM BACKUP
2325  */
2326 #if defined(SA_MODE)
2327  if (r_args->restore_slave)
2328  {
2329  (void) logpb_remove_all_in_log_path (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, log_path, log_prefix);
2330  }
2331 #endif /* SA_MODE */
2332  error_code = logpb_restore (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, log_path, log_prefix, r_args);
2333  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2334  {
2335  goto error;
2336  }
2337  }
2338 
2339  error_code = spage_boot (thread_p);
2340  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2341  {
2342  goto error;
2343  }
2344  error_code = heap_manager_initialize ();
2345  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2346  {
2347  goto error;
2348  }
2349 
2350  /*
2351  * Now continue the normal restart process. At this point the data volumes
2352  * are ok. However, some recovery may need to take place
2353  */
2354 
2355  /* Mount the data volume */
2356  error_code = boot_mount (thread_p, LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID, boot_Db_full_name, NULL);
2357  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2358  {
2359  goto error;
2360  }
2361 
2362  /* Find the location of the database parameters and read them */
2363  if (disk_get_boot_hfid (thread_p, LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID, &boot_Db_parm->hfid) == NULL)
2364  {
2365  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2366  goto error;
2367  }
2368 
2369  error_code = boot_get_db_parm (thread_p, boot_Db_parm, boot_Db_parm_oid);
2370  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2371  {
2372  goto error;
2373  }
2374  /* we need to manually add root class HFID to cache */
2375  error_code =
2376  heap_insert_hfid_for_class_oid (thread_p, &boot_Db_parm->rootclass_oid, &boot_Db_parm->rootclass_hfid, FILE_HEAP);
2377  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2378  {
2379  assert_release (false);
2380  goto error;
2381  }
2382 
2383  db_charset_db_header = boot_get_db_charset_from_header (thread_p, log_path, log_prefix);
2384  if (db_charset_db_header <= INTL_CODESET_NONE || INTL_CODESET_LAST < db_charset_db_header)
2385  {
2386  char er_msg[ERR_MSG_SIZE];
2387  snprintf (er_msg, sizeof (er_msg) - 1,
2388  "Cannot find a valid charset in log header or first volume header or different values have "
2389  "been found");
2390  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOC_INIT, 1, er_msg);
2391  error_code = ER_LOC_INIT;
2392  goto error;
2393  }
2394  else
2395  {
2396  lang_set_charset (db_charset_db_header);
2397  }
2398 
2399  /* Find the rest of the volumes and mount them */
2400 
2401  error_code = boot_find_rest_volumes (thread_p, from_backup ? r_args : NULL, LOG_DBFIRST_VOLID, boot_mount, NULL);
2402  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2403  {
2404  goto error;
2405  }
2406 
2407  /* initialize disk manager */
2408  error_code = disk_manager_init (thread_p, true);
2409  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2410  {
2411  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2412  goto error;
2413  }
2414 
2415  error_code = logtb_initialize_global_unique_stats_table (thread_p);
2416  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2417  {
2418  goto error;
2419  }
2420 
2421  error_code = file_tracker_load (thread_p, &boot_Db_parm->trk_vfid);
2422  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2423  {
2424  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2425  goto error;
2426  }
2427  catalog_initialize (&boot_Db_parm->ctid);
2428 
2429  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_DISABLE_VACUUM) == false)
2430  {
2431  /* We need to load vacuum data and initialize vacuum routine before recovery. */
2432  error_code =
2433  vacuum_initialize (thread_p, boot_Db_parm->vacuum_log_block_npages, &boot_Db_parm->vacuum_data_vfid,
2434  &boot_Db_parm->dropped_files_vfid);
2435  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2436  {
2437  goto error;
2438  }
2439  }
2440 
2441  oid_set_root (&boot_Db_parm->rootclass_oid);
2442 
2443  /* Load and recover data pages before log recovery */
2444  error_code = dwb_load_and_recover_pages (thread_p, log_path, log_prefix);
2445  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2446  {
2447  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2448  goto error;
2449  }
2450 
2451  /*
2452  * Now restart the recovery manager and execute any recovery actions
2453  */
2454 
2455  log_initialize (thread_p, boot_Db_full_name, log_path, log_prefix, from_backup, r_args);
2456 
2457  error_code = boot_after_copydb (thread_p); // only does something if this is first boot after copydb
2458  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2459  {
2460  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2461  goto error;
2462  }
2463 
2464 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2465  pgbuf_daemons_init ();
2466  dwb_daemons_init ();
2467 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
2468 
2469  // after recovery we can boot vacuum
2470  error_code = vacuum_boot (thread_p);
2471  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2472  {
2473  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2474  goto error;
2475  }
2476 
2477  /*
2478  * Initialize the catalog manager, the query evaluator, and install meta
2479  * classes
2480  */
2481 
2482  error_code = locator_initialize (thread_p);
2483  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2484  {
2485  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2486  goto error;
2487  }
2488 
2489  error_code = catcls_find_and_set_cached_class_oid (thread_p);
2490  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2491  {
2492  goto error;
2493  }
2494 
2495  error_code = xcache_initialize (thread_p);
2496  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2497  {
2498  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2499  goto error;
2500  }
2501 
2502  if (qmgr_initialize (thread_p) != NO_ERROR)
2503  {
2504  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2505  goto error;
2506  }

2509  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2510  {
2511  goto error;

2515  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2516  {

2519  }

2523  */
2524  error_code =

2526 
2527  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2528  {
2529  goto error;
2530  }
2531

2533  {

2535  snprintf (er_msg, sizeof (er_msg) - 1, "Invalid charset in db_root system table: expecting %s, found %s",
2536  lang_charset_cubrid_name (db_charset_db_header), lang_charset_cubrid_name (db_charset_db_root));
2537  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOC_INIT, 1, er_msg);
2538  error_code = ER_LOC_INIT;
2539  goto error;

2543  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2544  {

2557  goto error;
2558  }
2559  }

2567  {
2568  goto error;
2569  }

2573  * Allocate a temporary transaction index to finish further system related
2574  * changes such as removal of temporary volumes and modifications of
2575  * system parameter
2576  */
2577 
2578  /* todo: I am not sure we really need a transaction here. but since we are hurrying to release 10.1 and we don't have
2579  * time to do changes that may have a significant impact on database behavior, I'd rather keep this for now.
2580  * We should rethink the boot_Db_parm implementation altogether and we can come back to this when we do it. */
2581  tran_index =
2582  logtb_assign_tran_index (thread_p, NULL_TRANID, TRAN_ACTIVE, NULL, NULL, TRAN_LOCK_INFINITE_WAIT,
2583  TRAN_DEFAULT_ISOLATION_LEVEL ());
2584  if (tran_index == NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
2585  {
2586  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2587  goto error;
2588  }

2591  * Remove any database temporary volumes
2592  */

2596  if (boot_Lob_path[0] != '\0')
2597  {
2598  error_code = es_init (boot_Lob_path);
2599  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2600  {
2601  goto error;
2602  }
2603  }

2607  }
2608

2610  {
2611  assert_release (false);
2612  error_code = ER_FAILED;
2613  goto error;
2614  }

2616  tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;

2618 
2619  if (!tf_Metaclass_class.mc_n_variable)
2620  {
2621  tf_compile_meta_classes ();
2622  }
2623 
2624  if (skip_to_check_ct_classes_for_rebuild == false)
2625  {
2626  if (catcls_Enable != true)
2627  {
2628  error_code = catcls_compile_catalog_classes (thread_p);
2629  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2630  {
2631  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_MISSING_OR_INVALID_CATALOG, 0);
2632  goto error;
2633  }
2634  }
2635  }
2636 
2637  /* check server collations with database collations */
2638  if (check_coll_and_timezone->check_db_coll == true)
2639  {
2640  LANG_COLL_COMPAT *db_collations = NULL;
2641  int db_coll_cnt;
2642 
2643  error_code = catcls_get_db_collation (thread_p, &db_collations, &db_coll_cnt);
2644  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2645  {
2646  if (db_collations != NULL)
2647  {
2648  db_private_free (thread_p, db_collations);
2649  }
2650  goto error;
2651  }
2652 
2653  if (db_collations != NULL)

2656  db_private_free (thread_p, db_collations);
2657  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2658  {
2659  goto error;
2660  }
2661  }
2662  }
2663 
2664 #if defined (SA_MODE)
2665  /* Completely vacuum database. */
2666  if (r_args == NULL || r_args->is_restore_from_backup == false)
2667  {
2668  er_clear (); /* forget any warning or error to start vacuumming */
2669  xvacuum (thread_p);
2670  }
2671 #endif
2672 
2673  /* read only mode ? */
2674  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_READ_ONLY_MODE))
2675  {
2676  logtb_disable_update (NULL);
2677  }
2678 
2679  error_code = serial_initialize_cache_pool (thread_p);
2680  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2681  {
2682  goto error;
2683  }
2684 
2685  error_code = session_states_init (thread_p);
2686  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2687  {
2688  goto error;
2689  }
2690 
2691 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
2692  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_ACCESS_IP_CONTROL) == true && from_backup == false)
2693  {
2694  error_code = css_set_accessible_ip_info ();
2695  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2696  {
2697  goto error;
2698  }
2699  }
2700 #endif
2701 
2702 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
2703  /* set number of hosts */
2704  css_set_ha_num_of_hosts (db->num_hosts);
2705  /* set server's starting mode for HA according to the 'ha_mode' parameter */
2706  css_change_ha_server_state (thread_p, (HA_SERVER_STATE) prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_HA_SERVER_STATE), false,
2707  HA_CHANGE_MODE_IMMEDIATELY, true);
2708 #endif
2709

2711  error_code = partition_cache_init (thread_p);
2712  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2713  {
2714  goto error;
2715  }
2716 
2717  cfg_free_directory (dir);
2718 
2719  if (print_restart)
2720  {
2721 #if defined (NDEBUG)

2723  BOOT_FORMAT_MAX_LENGTH);
2724  fprintf (stdout, format, rel_name ());
2725 #else /* NDEBUG */
2726  fprintf (stdout, "\n%s (%s) (%d debug build)\n\n", rel_name (), rel_build_number (), rel_bit_platform ());
2727 #endif /* !NDEBUG */
2728  }
2729 
2730  if (from_backup == true)
2731  {
2732  log_set_ha_promotion_time (thread_p, 0);
2733  log_set_db_restore_time (thread_p, (INT64) (time (0)));
2734  }
2735 
2736  /* server status could be changed by css_change_ha_server_state */
2737  if (boot_Server_status == BOOT_SERVER_DOWN)
2738  {
2739  /* server is up! */
2740  boot_server_status (BOOT_SERVER_UP);
2741  }
2742 #if !defined(SA_MODE)
2743  json_set_alloc_funcs (malloc, free);
2744 #endif
2745 
2746  return NO_ERROR;
2747 
2748 error:
2749  if (dir != NULL)
2750  {
2751  cfg_free_directory (dir);
2752  dir = NULL;
2753  }
2754  prev_err_msg = (char *) er_msg ();
2755  if (prev_err_msg != NULL)
2756  {
2757  prev_err_msg = strdup (prev_err_msg);
2758  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNABLE_TO_RESTART_SERVER, 1, prev_err_msg);
2759  free_and_init (prev_err_msg);
2760  }
2761  else
2762  {
2763  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_UNABLE_TO_RESTART_SERVER, 1, "");
2764  }
2765 
2766  if (tran_index != NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
2767  {
2768  logtb_free_tran_index (thread_p, tran_index);
2769  }
2770 
2771  session_states_finalize (thread_p);
2772  logtb_finalize_global_unique_stats_table (thread_p);
2773 
2774  vacuum_stop (thread_p);
2775 
2776 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2777  pgbuf_daemons_destroy ();
2778  dwb_daemons_destroy ();
2779 #endif
2780 
2781  log_final (thread_p);
2782  fpcache_finalize (thread_p);
2783  qfile_finalize_list_cache (thread_p);
2784  xcache_finalize (thread_p);
2785 
2786 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2787  css_final_conn_list ();
2788 #endif
2789 
2790  er_stack_push ();
2791  boot_server_all_finalize (thread_p, ER_THREAD_FINAL, BOOT_SHUTDOWN_EXCEPT_COMMON_MODULES);
2792  er_stack_pop ();
2793 
2794 #if defined (SA_MODE)
2795  cubthread::finalize ();
2796 #endif /* SA_MODE */
2797 
2798  return error_code;
2799 }

2801 /*
2802  * xboot_restart_from_backup () - restore the database system from backup.
2803  * used for media crash recovery
2804  *
2805  * return : Transaction index
2806  *
2807  * print_restart(in): Flag which indicates if the version of CUBRID server
2808  * is printed at the end of the restart process.
2809  * db_name(in): Database Name
2810  * r_args(in): restart argument structure contains various options
2811  *
2812  * Note: The database is restored from its backup and from all archive
2813  * and active logs with information recoded since the backup. If
2814  * these files are not actually placed in the location of the log
2815  * files, the system will request those files.
2816  */
2817 int
2818 xboot_restart_from_backup (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int print_restart, const char *db_name, BO_RESTART_ARG * r_args)
2819 {
2820  CHECK_ARGS check_coll_and_timezone = { true, true };
2821 
2822  if (lang_init () != NO_ERROR)
2823  {
2824  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
2825  {
2826  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOC_INIT, 1, "Failed to initialize language module");
2827  }
2828  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2829  }
2830 
2831  /* initialize time zone data, optional module */
2832  if (tz_load () != NO_ERROR)
2833  {
2834  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
2835  {
2836  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR, 1, "Failed to initialize timezone module");
2837  }
2838  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2839  }
2840 
2841  /* open the system message catalog, before prm_ ? */
2842  if (msgcat_init () != NO_ERROR)
2843  {
2844  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_CANNOT_ACCESS_MESSAGE_CATALOG, 0);
2845  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2846  }
2847 
2848  /* initialize system parameters */
2849  if (sysprm_load_and_init (NULL, NULL, SYSPRM_LOAD_ALL) != NO_ERROR)
2850  {
2851  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2852  }
2853 
2854  prm_set_bool_value (PRM_ID_DBFILES_PROTECT, false);
2855 
2856  /*
2857  * We need to do some initialization that normally happens in
2858  * boot_restart_server(), but only if the SERVER_MODE CPP variable is
2859  * defined. Unfortunately, if we're here, then SERVER_MODE is not defined
2860  * so call the important initializers ourselves.
2861  *
2862  * Initialize allocations areas for things we need
2863  * Initialize the type/doain module (also sets up an area)
2864  */
2865 
2866  area_init ();
2867 
2868  if (tp_init () != NO_ERROR)
2869  {
2870  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2871  }
2872 
2873  if (boot_restart_server (thread_p, print_restart, db_name, true, &check_coll_and_timezone, r_args) != NO_ERROR)
2874  {
2875  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2876  }
2877  else
2878  {
2879  return LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
2880  }
2881 }
2882 
2883 /*
2884  * xboot_shutdown_server () - shutdown CUBRID server
2885  *
2886  * return : true
2887  *
2888  * thread_p (in/out) : input thread entry; outputs NULL if thread is finalized (SA_MODE)
2889  * is_er_final(in): Terminate the error module..
2890  *
2891  * Note: All active transactions of all clients are aborted and the
2892  * CUBRID server is terminated. Any database temporarily volume
2893  * is destroyed.
2894  */
2895 bool
2896 xboot_shutdown_server (REFPTR (THREAD_ENTRY, thread_p), ER_FINAL_CODE is_er_final)
2897 {
2898  if (!BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED ())
2899  {
2900  return true;
2901  }
2902 
2903 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
2904  boot_check_db_at_num_shutdowns (true);
2905 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
2906 
2907  sysprm_set_force (prm_get_name (PRM_ID_SUPPRESS_FSYNC), "0");
2908 
2909  /* Shutdown the system with the system transaction */
2910  logtb_set_to_system_tran_index (thread_p);
2911  log_abort_all_active_transaction (thread_p);
2912  vacuum_stop (thread_p);
2913 
2914  /* before removing temp vols */
2915  (void) logtb_reflect_global_unique_stats_to_btree (thread_p);
2916  qfile_finalize_list_cache (thread_p);
2917  xcache_finalize (thread_p);
2918  fpcache_finalize (thread_p);
2919  session_states_finalize (thread_p);
2920 
2921  (void) boot_remove_all_temp_volumes (thread_p, REMOVE_TEMP_VOL_DEFAULT_ACTION);
2922 
2923 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2924  pgbuf_daemons_destroy ();
2925 #endif
2926 
2927  log_final (thread_p);
2928 
2929  /* Since all pages were flushed, now it's safe to destroy DWB. */
2930  (void) dwb_destroy (thread_p);
2931 
2932  if (is_er_final == ER_ALL_FINAL)
2933  {
2934  boot_server_all_finalize (thread_p, is_er_final, BOOT_SHUTDOWN_EXCEPT_COMMON_MODULES);
2935  }
2936  else
2937  {
2938  er_stack_push ();
2939  boot_server_all_finalize (thread_p, is_er_final, BOOT_SHUTDOWN_EXCEPT_COMMON_MODULES);
2940  er_stack_pop ();
2941  }
2942 
2943 #if defined (SA_MODE)
2944  // stop thread module
2945  cubthread::finalize ();
2946  thread_p = NULL;
2947 #endif // SA_MODE
2948 
2949  return true;
2950 }

2952 /*
2953  * xboot_get_server_session_key ()
2954  */
2955 const char *
2956 xboot_get_server_session_key (void)
2957 {
2958  return boot_Server_session_key;
2959 }
