5763 int
5764 boot_get_new_volume_name_and_id (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, DB_VOLTYPE voltype, const char *given_path,
5765  const char *given_name, char *fullname_newvol_out, VOLID * volid_newvol_out)
5766 {
5767  char buf_temp_path[PATH_MAX];
5768  const char *temp_path = NULL;
5769  const char *temp_name = NULL;
5770 
5771  if (voltype == DB_PERMANENT_VOLTYPE)
5772  {
5773  *volid_newvol_out = boot_Db_parm->last_volid + 1;
5774  if (*volid_newvol_out > LOG_MAX_DBVOLID
5775  || (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols > 0 && *volid_newvol_out >= boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid))
5776  {
5777  /* should be caught early */
5778  assert (false);
5779  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_MAXNUM_VOLS_HAS_BEEN_EXCEEDED, 1, LOG_MAX_DBVOLID);
5780  return ER_BO_MAXNUM_VOLS_HAS_BEEN_EXCEEDED;
5781  }
5782 
5783  if (given_path != NULL)
5784  {
5785  temp_path = given_path;
5786  }
5787  else
5788  {
5789  temp_path = prm_get_string_value (PRM_ID_IO_VOLUME_EXT_PATH);
5790  if (temp_path == NULL)
5791  {
5792  temp_path = fileio_get_directory_path (buf_temp_path, boot_Db_full_name);
5793  if (temp_path == NULL)
5794  {
5795  buf_temp_path[0] = '\0';
5796  temp_path = buf_temp_path;
5797  }
5798  }
5799 
5800  }
5801  if (given_name != NULL)
5802  {
5803  temp_name = given_name;
5804 
5805  fileio_make_volume_ext_given_name (fullname_newvol_out, temp_path, given_name);
5806  }
5807  else
5808  {
5809  temp_name = fileio_get_base_file_name (boot_Db_full_name);
5810  fileio_make_volume_ext_name (fullname_newvol_out, temp_path, temp_name, *volid_newvol_out);
5811  }
5812  }
5813  else
5814  {
5815  *volid_newvol_out = boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols > 0 ? boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid - 1 : LOG_MAX_DBVOLID;
5816  if (*volid_newvol_out <= boot_Db_parm->last_volid)
5817  {
5818  /* should be caught early */
5819  assert (false);
5820  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_BO_MAXNUM_VOLS_HAS_BEEN_EXCEEDED, 1, LOG_MAX_DBVOLID);
5821  return ER_BO_MAXNUM_VOLS_HAS_BEEN_EXCEEDED;
5822  }
5823  assert (given_path == NULL && given_name == NULL);
5824 
5825  temp_path = (char *) prm_get_string_value (PRM_ID_IO_TEMP_VOLUME_PATH);
5826  if (temp_path == NULL || temp_path[0] == '\0')
5827  {
5828  temp_path = fileio_get_directory_path (buf_temp_path, boot_Db_full_name);
5829  }
5830  temp_name = fileio_get_base_file_name (boot_Db_full_name);
5831  fileio_make_volume_temp_name (fullname_newvol_out, temp_path, temp_name, *volid_newvol_out);
5832  }
5833 
5834  return NO_ERROR;
5835 }
5836 
5837 int
5838 boot_dbparm_save_volume (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, DB_VOLTYPE voltype, VOLID volid)
5839 {
5840  VPID vpid_boot_bp_parm;
5841  BOOT_DB_PARM save_boot_db_parm = *boot_Db_parm;
5842 
5843  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
5844 
5845  assert (log_check_system_op_is_started (thread_p));
5846 
5847  if (voltype == DB_PERMANENT_VOLTYPE)
5848  {
5849  assert (boot_Db_parm->nvols >= 0);
5850  if (volid != boot_Db_parm->last_volid + 1)
5851  {
5852  assert_release (false);
5853  error_code = ER_FAILED;
5854  goto exit;
5855  }
5856  boot_Db_parm->last_volid = volid;
5857  boot_Db_parm->nvols++;
5858  }
5859  else
5860  {
5861  if (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols < 0 || (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols == 0 && volid != LOG_MAX_DBVOLID)
5862  || (boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols > 0 && boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid - 1 != volid))
5863  {
5864  /* invalid volid */
5865  assert_release (false);
5866  error_code = ER_FAILED;
5867  goto exit;
5868  }
5869  boot_Db_parm->temp_nvols++;
5870  boot_Db_parm->temp_last_volid = volid;
5871  }
5872 
5873  /* todo: is flush needed? */
5874  VPID_GET_FROM_OID (&vpid_boot_bp_parm, boot_Db_parm_oid);
5875  log_append_undo_data2 (thread_p, RVPGBUF_FLUSH_PAGE, NULL, NULL, 0, sizeof (vpid_boot_bp_parm), &vpid_boot_bp_parm);
5876 
5877  error_code = boot_db_parm_update_heap (thread_p);
5878  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
5879  {
5880  ASSERT_ERROR ();
5881  *boot_Db_parm = save_boot_db_parm;
5882  goto exit;
5883  }
5884 
5885  /* flush the boot_Db_parm object. this is not necessary but it is recommended in order to mount every known volume
5886  * during restart. that may not be possible during media crash though. */
5887  heap_flush (thread_p, boot_Db_parm_oid);
5888  fileio_synchronize (thread_p, fileio_get_volume_descriptor (boot_Db_parm_oid->volid), NULL, FILEIO_SYNC_ALSO_FLUSH_DWB); /* label? */
5889 
5890 exit:
5891  return error_code;
5892 }
5893 
5894 /*
5895  * boot_db_parm_update_heap () - update heap record for boot_Db_parm
5896  *
5897  * return : error code
5898  * thread_p (in) : thread entry
5899  */
5900 STATIC_INLINE int
5901 boot_db_parm_update_heap (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
5902 {
5903  HEAP_SCANCACHE scan_cache;
5904  HEAP_OPERATION_CONTEXT update_context;
5905  RECDES recdes;
5906 
5907  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
5908 
5909  recdes.length = recdes.area_size = sizeof (*boot_Db_parm);
5910  recdes.data = (char *) boot_Db_parm;
5911 
5912  /* note that we start a scan cache with NULL class_oid. That's because boot_Db_parm_oid doesn't really have a class!
5913  * we have to start the scan cache this way so it can cache also cache file type for heap_update_logical.
5914  * otherwise it will try to read it from cache using root class OID. which actually has its own heap file and its own
5915  * heap file type.
5916  */
5917  error_code = heap_scancache_start_modify (thread_p, &scan_cache, &boot_Db_parm->hfid, NULL, SINGLE_ROW_UPDATE, NULL);
5918  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
5919  {
5920  ASSERT_ERROR ();
5921  return error_code;
5922  }
5923 
5924  /* hack the class to avoid heap_scancache_check_with_hfid. */
5925  scan_cache.node.class_oid = *oid_Root_class_oid;
5926  heap_create_update_context (&update_context, &boot_Db_parm->hfid, boot_Db_parm_oid, &boot_Db_parm->rootclass_oid,
5927  &recdes, &scan_cache, UPDATE_INPLACE_CURRENT_MVCCID);
5928  error_code = heap_update_logical (thread_p, &update_context);
5929  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
5930  {
5931  ASSERT_ERROR ();
5932  }
5933  heap_scancache_end (thread_p, &scan_cache);
5934  return error_code;
5935 }
5936 
5937 //
5938 // boot_after_copydb - do whatever checks and changes necessary on first boot of copied database.
5939 // copydb is quite rudimentary; it will just copy page by page as is, and then reset the LSA's.
5940 // some of database stuff may be contextual (e.g. stuff that depend on log like vacuum), and
5941 // here that stuff must be handled
5942 //
5943 static int
5944 boot_after_copydb (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
5945 {
5946  if (!log_Gl.hdr.was_copied)
5947  {
5948  // this is not after copydb
5949  return NO_ERROR;
5950  }
5951 
5952  int error_code = vacuum_reset_data_after_copydb (thread_p);
5953  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
5954  {
5955  ASSERT_ERROR ();
5956  return error_code;
5957  }
5958 
5959  // finished booting after copydb
5960  log_Gl.hdr.was_copied = false;
5961 
5962  // flush log and header to disk to make sure everything is saved
5963  LOG_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
5964  logpb_flush_pages_direct (thread_p);
5965  logpb_flush_header (thread_p);
5966  LOG_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
5967 
5968  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "Complete boot_after_copydb \n");
5969 
5970  return NO_ERROR;
5971 }
